title: Former driving school owner gets 1 day in jail for RMV bribery scheme
author: Molly Farrar
bullets: Carlos Cardosa, 72, former driving school owner, sentenced to 1 day in prison for RMV bribery scheme.
Cardosa bribed a Brockton RMV employee $20,000 over 18 months, fraudulently passing 100-300 driver's license tests.
Cardosa's sentence reduced due to health issues from a 2022 assault; additional six months home detention imposed.

title: Stefon Diggs and Cardi B may have broken up following Patriots Super Bowl loss
author: Carson Lyle
bullets: Stefon Diggs and Cardi B may have broken up after unfollowing each other on Instagram post-Super Bowl loss.
Cardi B and Diggs welcomed a baby boy in November 2025, their first child together; Diggs' third and Cardi's fourth.
Diggs faces felony charges for alleged assault; arraignment set for February 13, following Super Bowl participation.

title: An emotional Alex Cora explains why Bad Bunny’s Super Bowl performance meant so much to him
author: Conor Ryan
bullets: Red Sox manager Alex Cora expressed pride in Bad Bunny's all-Spanish halftime show at Super Bowl LX.
Cora appreciated Bad Bunny's representation of Puerto Rican culture and his tribute to various American countries.
The performance sparked controversy, but NFL's Roger Goodell supported Bad Bunny for his unifying message.

title: Watch: Providence releases body cam footage of Brown University shooting response
author: Molly Farrar
bullets: Providence released 20 minutes of body cam footage showing police response to a fatal December shooting at Brown University.
The footage is part of a public records request and includes redactions; the investigation into the shooting is closed.
Shooter Claudio Manuel Neves Valente killed two students at Brown and an MIT professor before dying by suicide in New Hampshire.

title: Former Patriots lineman Keion White undergoes surgery after being shot in ankle in San Francisco
author: The Associated Press
bullets: Former Patriots lineman Keion White was shot in the ankle and underwent surgery in San Francisco on Monday.
The shooting occurred after the Super Bowl at Levi's Stadium, with police indicating a verbal altercation preceded the incident.
This is the second reported shooting involving a 49ers player in 18 months; no arrests have been made in White's case.

title: Jayson Tatum to practice with Maine Celtics as he nears potential return
author: Conor Ryan
bullets: Jayson Tatum practices with Maine Celtics as his Achilles recovery progresses after rupturing it in May 2025.
Tatum participated in controlled scrimmages, posted dunking videos, and held workouts indicating his ongoing rehabilitation progress.
Boston Celtics remain cautious about Tatum's return, considering team chemistry after 50 games without him this season.

title: Hikers rescued in Vermont amid sub-zero temperatures
author: Carson Lyle
bullets: Two Canadian hikers were rescued from Camel's Hump mountain in Duxbury, Vermont, in sub-zero temperatures.
Rescue teams reached the hikers suffering from hypothermia around 11:20 p.m. after starting the search at 6 p.m.
The hikers, from Ontario, were safely evacuated; the woman was hospitalized but both are expected to recover.

title: 6 offseason priorities for Patriots after Super Bowl loss
author: Conor Ryan
bullets: Patriots need to improve the offensive line after Super Bowl losses; considering changes and draft options.
New England may pursue high-impact wide receivers to support franchise QB Drake Maye, such as A.J. Brown.
Patriots seek to rebuild roster depth, target pass rush improvements, and secure key contracts for 2026 season.

title: For this St. Lucian runner, the Boston Marathon is ‘nothing short of a dream’
author: Autumn Sloboda
bullets: Ava Fevrier aims to be the first St. Lucian woman to achieve a six-star marathon finish.
Fevrier is running the Boston Marathon for the Lingzi Foundation to fulfill a lifelong dream.
At age 42, Fevrier holds the St. Lucian female national record for the marathon distance.

title: Actor Henry Winkler named Emerson College’s 2026 commencement speaker
author: Annie Jonas
bullets: Henry Winkler, Emerson College alumnus, will be the 2026 commencement speaker at Emerson's Wang Theatre on May 9.
Winkler is known for his role as Fonzie on 'Happy Days' and won an Emmy for 'Barry'.
Winkler is a celebrated author, advocating for children with dyslexia, and was honored by Queen Elizabeth II.
